abstract.text: Build apps using a powerful open language.
A slice of an
, or
instance.
A collection that supports backward as well as forward traversal.
A sequence whose elements can be traversed multiple times,
nondestructively, and accessed by an indexed subscript.
A contiguously stored array.
The total number of elements that the array can contain without
allocating new storage.
Creates an array containing the elements of a sequence.
Creates an array with the specified capacity, then calls the given
closure with a buffer covering the array’s uninitialized memory.
Inserts a new element at the specified position.
Removes and returns the element at the specified position.
Reserves enough space to store the specified number of elements.
Calls a closure with a pointer to the array’s contiguous storage.
Calls the given closure with a pointer to the underlying bytes of the
array’s contiguous storage.
Calls the given closure with a pointer to the array’s mutable contiguous
storage.
Calls the given closure with a pointer to the underlying bytes of the
array’s mutable contiguous storage.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging
purposes.
A type that explicitly supplies its own mirror.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type that can decode itself from an external representation.
A type that can encode itself to an external representation.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be initialized using an array literal.
A type that can be hashed into a
to produce an integer hash value.
A collection that supports subscript assignment.
A collection that supports efficient random-access index traversal.
A collection that supports replacement of an arbitrary subrange of elements
with the elements of another collection.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent
contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
A type that provides sequential, iterated access to its elements.
A type that represents a mutable buffer.
A type that represents an immutable buffer.
A protocol that provides consistent data access to the bytes underlying contiguous and noncontiguous data buffers.
A protocol that declares the type offers direct access to the underlying raw bytes in a contiguous manner.
A protocol that provides consistent data access to the bytes underlying contiguous and noncontiguous mutable data buffers.
